thread.title: Tottenham transfer news: Mauricio Pochettino lining up surprise bid for Burnley star Andre Gray in the summer window
thread.title_full: Tottenham transfer news: Mauricio Pochettino lining up surprise bid for Burnley star Andre Gray in the summer window

author: dfraser
title: Tottenham transfer news: Mauricio Pochettino lining up surprise bid for Burnley star Andre Gray in the summer window
text:
EFL Gray Hart Lane Tottenham transfer news: Mauricio Pochettino lining up surprise bid for Burnley star Andre Gray in the summer window 
Spurs chief looking to Clarets striker to add more depth to his front-line, with back-up forward Vincent Janssen struggling Gossip 5th March 2017, 11:43 am Updated: 5th March 2017, 11:47 am Comments TOTTENHAM boss Mauricio Pochettino is lining up a surprise summer swoop for Burnley striker Andre Gray. 
According to the Express , the Spurs chief is hoping to alleviate some of the pressure on Harry Kane as the north Londoners look to keep up with Chelsea and Co. Getty Images 4 Andre Gray scored in Burnley’s 3-2 defeat at the hands of Swansea on Saturday 
England man Kane has enjoyed yet another superb season at White Hart Lane, netting a league-high 17 Premier League goals already this term. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
However, back-up forward Vincent Janssen has struggled mightily in his first season in England – netting just once in the league, despite playing in 15 Prem games. 
Meanwhile, Gray has enjoyed a breakout season at Turf Moor under Sean Dyche in 2016-17 – scoring twice in Saturday’s 3-2 defeat at the hands of Swansea. Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Tottenham v Everton EPA 4 Andre Gray has been in superb goalscoring form for Burnley this season 
The former Luton Town striker is being tipped for his first Three Lions call-up by boss Gareth Southgate, having scored eight goals for a Burnley outfit who have found the net just 30 times in 27 games this year. 
Should Gray make it into the England squad it would be good practice for the Clarets man - as Spurs are set to play all of their home matches at Wembley next season. Reuters Mauricio Pochettino is hoping to take some of the scoring pressure off Harry Kane Reuters 4 Harry Kane has been in fine form himself this term, with a league-high 17 goals 
With just 15 months left on his contract - and his stock rapidly rising - Dyche and Co may well consider cashing in on their star forward in the summer. 
The lure of European football may be too much for Gray to pass up, with Spurs looking set once more to make it into the Champions League.
